title: Add blank public POST /webhook/urpay route returning 200 OK

requirements.text: In `backend/main.mo`, add a public HTTP interface handler that responds to POST requests at the path `/webhook/urpay` with a 200 OK status and an empty body. This must be implemented as an `http_request_update` (or equivalent ICP HTTP gateway handler) so the canister accepts and acknowledges the incoming POST from urpay. No payload parsing, no business logic, and no state changes are required — the sole purpose is to return a 200 OK response so the endpoint can be verified as reachable.

quotes: only add a blank public POST route at /webhook/urpay. Just ensure the route exists and returns a '200 OK' status so I can test the connection.

acceptanceCriteria: A POST request to /webhook/urpay returns an HTTP 200 status code.
No request body parsing or business logic is executed.
No changes are made to any existing backend state or data structures.

constraints: Do not make any UI or frontend changes.
Do not parse or act on the webhook payload — this is a stub only.
Do not modify any existing backend methods or data structures.
nonGoals: Extracting user_email or payment_status from the webhook payload.
Setting isPro=true based on webhook data.
Live dashboard updates triggered by the webhook.
